result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence LJ Dear was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lawrence LJ Dear is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lawrence LJ Dear was found guilty of Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Lawrence LJ Dear was found guilty of Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lawrence LJ Dear in court with attorney David J Susens.  Defendant Lawrence LJ Dear in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  Parties recv'd and reviewed revocation summary.  Atty. Susens states a few corrections in summary.  Parties have a stipulation to sentence.  Atty. Ryan makes statement.  Atty. Susens makes statement.  DE makes statement.  Court admonishes DE and gives felony admonishment.  Court imposes sentence.

Counts 1 & 2: 
WI State Prison for 3 years (18 mos. ars Initial Confinement/18 mos. Extended Supervision) Concurrent to each other and any other
127 days credit
Any counseling deemed appropriate
Any unpaid financial obligations to be civil judgment
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Paperwork handed in court
Outagamie Co. jail
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 13, 2018 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lawrence LJ Dear in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Tsai states matter is resolved.  State states recs.  Court notes no prelim waiver has been done.  DE waives his right to prelim.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  Atty Tsai acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and enters NC pleas to Cts 1 and 2.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  Atty Tsai makes statement on behalf of DE.  Court sentences.

Cts 1 and 2:  NC
3 years probation on each concurrent to each other
Conditions of probation:
Restitution $2,942.39 plus any applicable surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Court's Office per agent
DNA sample to be provided unless one has previously been provided
Costs/surcharges of $528.00 to be paid to Clerk of Court's Office per agent
Counseling/treatment and any other conditions per agent
To report to P&P today
Ct 3:  Dismissed
Plea hearing on June 29, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Rick C Spoentgen and intern Cody M.  appeared for the State of Wisconsin. There is a resolution but need time for restitution.  Reset 3 weeks off 1:00 calendar.
Status conference on May 26, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tsai states he thinks the matter will be resolved.  Requests reset for STC.  State requests RD as she thinks the DE should be appearing.  Atty Tsai responds.  Court notes argument is re: whether DE be required to appear or not.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Lawrence LJ Dear in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Tsai states DE will waive the time limits for the prelim today.  State notes witness was called off already.  Atty Tsai requests STC be set.  Time limits waived for prelim.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
